Utterance: Hi there! Welcome back! How have you been since our last session?
Hey, Ellie. I’ve had some ups and downs, but I’ve been trying to stick to the goals we set.
That’s great to hear! How did the breathing exercises go for you?
I actually used them a few times when I felt stressed, and it helped.
Wonderful! I’m glad you found them useful. How about your bedtime goal? Were you able to stick to it?
I managed to get to bed by midnight a few nights, but I still slipped back into my old habits a couple of times.
That’s okay! Change takes time. What do you think made it difficult to stick to the bedtime?
I got caught up in playing poker online again.
It’s easy to lose track of time with activities we enjoy. Perhaps we can brainstorm some strategies to help you balance your interests with your sleep goals.
That would be helpful.
One idea could be to set a timer for yourself while you play. Would you be willing to try that?
Yeah, I can try setting a timer.
Great! And how has your mood been overall? Any changes since we last spoke?
I’ve had some good days, but I still feel moody at times.
It’s perfectly normal to have fluctuations in mood. Have you noticed any specific triggers for those mood swings?
Stress, mostly. And sometimes just feeling lonely.
Loneliness can be tough. Have you thought about reaching out to friends or engaging in social activities?
I’ve been thinking about it. I don’t have a big circle, though.
That’s understandable. Even small interactions can make a difference. Would you consider joining a local poker club or a group related to your hobbies?
That could be interesting. I’ve never really thought about it.
It might be a good way to meet new people who share your interests. Plus, it could help combat feelings of loneliness.
Yeah, I think I’ll look into that.
Awesome! Now, last time we discussed boundaries with your parents. Have you had a chance to reflect on that?
I thought about it a bit. I think I need to distance myself more to protect my mental health.
That’s a healthy realization. Setting boundaries can be empowering. How do you envision those boundaries?
I think I’ll limit contact and not engage in conversations that lead to conflict.
That sounds like a solid plan. It’s important to prioritize your well-being. How do you feel about taking that step?
A little nervous, but I think it’s necessary.
That’s completely valid. It’s natural to feel apprehensive about change. Would you like to role-play a scenario where you set a boundary?
Sure, that could help.
Okay, imagine a situation where your parents reach out to you. How would you respond?
I’d say something like, “I’m not in a good place to talk right now.”
That’s a good start! It’s direct and sets the tone. Would you like to add anything else?
Maybe I could say, “Let’s talk later when I’m feeling better.”
Perfect! That keeps the door open while prioritizing your feelings. How does that feel to say?
It feels empowering.
I’m glad to hear that! Remember, it’s okay to prioritize your needs. Is there anything else you’d like to work on today?
I think we covered a lot.
Great! So to recap, you’ll try setting a timer for your poker sessions, look into joining a local club, and work on setting boundaries with your parents. Sound good?
Yes, that sounds good!
Wonderful! I look forward to hearing how everything goes next time. Take care!
Thanks, Ellie. Bye!
Bye!
